Introduction to APIs
item.description:
This is the first article about APIs, HTTP APIs and Open API.

I will start placing a common ground about what a generic API is, and why an API is important. Because an API is a complex artifact, it’s important to show its most important features.

Then, I will focus on HTTP APIs and how to be represented them, and then I will explain why instead of creating your own way of documenting an API, you want to use a standard way of representing HTTP APIs which is called Open API.

What Is Code Formatting and Why Does It Matter
item.description:
Can an AutoFormat Tool Increase Productivity?

The answer is yes.

The book “The Pragmatic Programmer” talks about the entropy of the code. Entropy is a physical quantity linked to molecular disorder. This is perhaps the only physical quantity that we can find in software. The larger the disorder, the higher the entropy. The more entropic your software is, the harder it will be to work with it day by day.

To explain why, I’ll give you an example.
